1.text: The beginning of the Good News of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

2.text: As it is written in the prophets, “Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.

3.text: The voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make ready the way of the Lord! Make his paths straight!’”

4.text: John came baptizing in the wilderness and preaching the baptism of repentance for forgiveness of sins.

5.text: All the country of Judea and all those of Jerusalem went out to him. They were baptized by him in the Jordan river, confessing their sins.

6.text: John was clothed with camel’s hair and a leather belt around his waist. He ate locusts and wild honey.

7.text: He preached, saying, “After me comes he who is mightier than I, the thong of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and loosen.

8.text: I baptized you in water, but he will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.”

9.text: It happened in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan.

10.text: Immediately coming up from the water, he saw the heavens parting, and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.

11.text: A voice came out of the sky, “You are my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”

12.text: Immediately the Spirit drove him out into the wilderness.

13.text: He was there in the wilderness forty days tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals; and the angels were serving him.

14.text: Now after John was taken into custody, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the Good News of the Kingdom of God,

15.text: and saying, “The time is fulfilled, and the Kingdom of God is at hand! Repent, and believe in the Good News.”

16.text: Passing along by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew the brother of Simon casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.

17.text: Jesus said to them, “Come after me, and I will make you into fishers for men.”

18.text: Immediately they left their nets, and followed him.

19.text: Going on a little further from there, he saw James the son of Zebedee, and John, his brother, who were also in the boat mending the nets.

20.text: Immediately he called them, and they left their father, Zebedee, in the boat with the hired servants, and went after him.

21.text: They went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath day he entered into the synagogue and taught.

22.text: They were astonished at his teaching, for he taught them as having authority, and not as the scribes.

23.text: Immediately there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit, and he cried out,

24.text: saying, “Ha! What do we have to do with you, Jesus, you Nazarene? Have you come to destroy us? I know you who you are: the Holy One of God!”

25.text: Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be quiet, and come out of him!”

26.text: The unclean spirit, convulsing him and crying with a loud voice, came out of him.

27.text: They were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, saying, “What is this? A new teaching? For with authority he commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey him!”

28.text: The report of him went out immediately everywhere into all the region of Galilee and its surrounding area.

29.text: Immediately, when they had come out of the synagogue, they came into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.

30.text: Now Simon’s wife’s mother lay sick with a fever, and immediately they told him about her.

31.text: He came and took her by the hand, and raised her up. The fever left her, and she served them.

32.text: At evening, when the sun had set, they brought to him all who were sick, and those who were possessed by demons.

33.text: All the city was gathered together at the door.

34.text: He healed many who were sick with various diseases, and cast out many demons. He didn’t allow the demons to speak, because they knew him.

35.text: Early in the morning, while it was still dark, he rose up and went out, and departed into a deserted place, and prayed there.

36.text: Simon and those who were with him followed after him;

37.text: and they found him, and told him, “Everyone is looking for you.”

38.text: He said to them, “Let’s go elsewhere into the next towns, that I may preach there also, because I came out for this reason.”

39.text: He went into their synagogues throughout all Galilee, preaching and casting out demons.

40.text: A leper came to him, begging him, kneeling down to him, and saying to him, “If you want to, you can make me clean.”

41.text: Being moved with compassion, he stretched out his hand, and touched him, and said to him, “I want to. Be made clean.”

42.text: When he had said this, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was made clean.

43.text: He strictly warned him, and immediately sent him out,

44.text: and said to him, “See you say nothing to anybody, but go show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing the things which Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.”

45.text: But he went out, and began to proclaim it much, and to spread about the matter, so that Jesus could no more openly enter into a city, but was outside in desert places: and they came to him from everywhere.
